params.text:
Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Increased stress-induced salivary cortisol response
  • Decreased serum levels of insulin-like growth factor-1 (IGF-1) in children.

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Decreased serum levels of vitamin D
  •

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Decreased cognitive function including full scale IQ (FSIQ)
  • Altered neuromotor and neurosensory function, including gross and fine motor skills.
  • Altered mood and behavior that may contribute to learning deficits (including attention deficits, hyperactivity, autistic behaviors, conduct disorders)

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Peripheral neuropathy
  • Encephalopathy
